answers.answer: Tingling, burning, or numbness of face is usually a symptom related to a sensory nerve being damaged, diseased, or injured.Causes include:1.Physical nerve injury (e.g. a nerve entrapment or some type of pressure being applied to a nerve directly or to the spinal attachment of that nerve).2.Disease condition affecting the nerves (e.g. neuropathy, diabetic neuropathy, multiple sclerosis, diabetes, and others).I suggest that you get an opinion from a neurologist

question: Ihave noticed tingling in the right side of my face when bending forward . It starts at my cheek on moves to the top of the right side of my head. It only lasts for a few seconds. What could be the cause?
title: face tingling
